_accessibilityInstructions.touch: Usage instructions. Use swipe left for next. Use swipe right for previous. Use a double tab to select. Use a two finger slide up to go to the top of the page.
_accessibilityInstructions.notouch: Usage instructions. Use tab for next. Use shift tab for previous. Use enter to select. Use escape to go to the top of the page.
_accessibilityInstructions.ipad: Usage instructions for touchscreens. Use swipe left for next. Use swipe right for previous. Use a double tab to select. Use a two finger slide up to go to the top of the page. Usage instructions for keyboard access. Use left for next. Use right for previous. Use up and down together to select.

_ariaLabels.accessibilityToggleButton: By selecting this button you can set whether accessibility is turned on or off

_jsonschema.ariaRegion: This question requires you to input your answer in the codebox provided. When you have done so, select the submit button below.

_pageLevelProgress.pageLevelProgressIndicatorBar: Progress bar. Select here to view your current progress, and select an item to navigate to it. You have completed
_pageLevelProgress.pageLevelProgressEnd: You have reached the end of the list of page sections.

_buttons.disabledAriaLabel: This button is disabled at the moment

body:
This interactive tutorial enables you to go from zero to hero with the opportunity data modelling specification.

For publishers: This tutorial will show you how to create data that conforms to the opportunity data specification to describe many different activities. At each stage you will be able to define your own activity and check it against the intended lesson outcome. This will enable you to become as expert with the specification such that you can publish your own data according to the specification.

For users: This tutorial will help you understand the specification and help identify good sources of data for use in your applications. It will also help you understand the scope of the specification and potential for using the data within your own applications.

Each lesson should between 20-40 minutes to complete and it is highly recommended you follow the lessons in order.

Click on lesson 1 to get started
displayTitle: Working with the opportunity data standard
title: Working with the opportunity data standard
